# How to Integrate Appdome and AzureAD with OAuth2.0 Login

Last updated September 1, 2025 by Appdome

This guide explains how to integrate Appdome with Microsoft Azure AD. The configuration will allow IT to control employee access to apps and devices, ensuring only authorized users can work with Appdome’s mobile security tools and protecting sensitive data and operations. To integrate Appdome and Azure AD with [OAuth 2.0 Login,](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-oauth2-auth-code-flow) Appdome requires the following permissions:

* User. Read
* profile

Also, Appdome extracts the following information from Azure:

* First Name
* Surname
* Email
* Job title
* Mobile phone number
* Company Name
* ISO Country Code
* Profile image

## Integrating Appdome with Microsoft Azure AD

**Before You Begin:**

1. Contact Appdome Support team to activate “Enable Third Party Authentication” and select “Microsoft Office 365”.
2. The Admin user on Appdome must log in to the Appdome platform and authenticate via Azure AD (Microsoft Entra) to provide consent in accordance with their organization’s policy.  
   **Note**: The user performing this action must have one of the following roles in the Azure/Entra tenant:
   * Application Administrator
   * Application Owner
   * Cloud Application Administrator.

Once consent is granted, continue to the steps below.

**Step by Step:**

1. Go to Microsoft Azure and navigate to the **Enterprise Applications** service.  
   ![Enterprize Applications Button](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Enterprize-Applications-button.png)
2. Within the Enterprise Application service, search for the object ID: **27db11d5-92d4-4f26-879f-fd047be62053**
3. Add your Appdome-protected application.  
   ![Image 20231022 084157](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image-20231022-084157-2.png)

4. Navigate to the **Permissions** tab.
5. Click on **application registration** to access API permissions.  
   ![Application Registration](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Application-registration.png)
6. Within the API permissions section, grant the following permissions to the application:
   * User.Read
   * Profile  
     ![Api Permissions Page](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/API-Permissions-page.png)
7. Navigate back to the **Permissions** tab.  
   The granted permissions list is displayed.
8. Optionally, click **Grant admin consent for AppDome** to grant consent to all users in your organization when logging into Appdome.  
   ![Grant Admin Consent for Appdome](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Grant-Admin-Appdome.png)
9. Navigate to the **Properties** tab.  
   ![Properties Tab](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Properties-Button.png)
10. Toggle on **Enabled for users to sign in?** to activate the integration.  
    ![Enable Users Sign In Toggled on](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Enable-users-sign-in.png)

10. Toggle on **Assignment Required** if you would like to provide access only to employees who are registered to Appdome’s platform.  
    **Note:** If this setting is toggled off (disabled), any user within your company with a Microsoft account could log in to Appdome’s platform.

**Note**: It is possible to create a group and allow all users inside the group to log in. For more information, contact Appdome Support.
